episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" features facts about Blaise Pascal curing his toothache with math, Stonehenge not being a true henge, synchronized swimming having a high rate of concussions, and early phone boxes having attendants inside. The hosts explore these topics with humor and delve into historical anecdotes and modern implications.

facts.fact: Mathematician Blaise Pascal once cured his toothache by thinking about maths.
It turns out, Stonehenge isn't a henge.
The sport with the highest rate of concussion is synchronized swimming.
Early phone boxes came with a little man inside who would arrange the call for you, then wait outside until it was over.
